text: [Music]
so I've always had this tension between
engineering and building stuff and
finance right out of college I got a
really exciting offer to work at SpaceX
which is a company that builds rockets
and spacecraft love the work I did there
thought it was incredibly challenging
but on the side I was doing all this
Finance stuff and it was something that
I felt like I couldn't ignore so I took
a job at a private Equity company but I
really missed building something while I
was working in finance so now I'm trying
to get into startups particularly
personal finance interests me I'd like
to build some business that helps people
allocate their money better or helps
them to avoid unnecessary fees just
something that solves the problems that
everyone has my big goal in coming to
hbii was that when I have this
successful startup I'm not going to be
taken out of my own company once we get
some traction I don't want to be removed
simply because I don't have an MBA you
know I want that MBA I definitely think
of the world in terms of risk and right
now at this point in my life I'm trying
to take on as much risk as I can leaping
without knowing where you're going to
land is a skill that you need in
business a skill that you need in life a
skill that you need in your personal
relationships being able to practice
that in somewhere where there are
absolutely no risks is incredibly
helpful after coming to HBS and seeing
the people here who I respect the most
is definitely the ones who have taken
the most risk that I'm envious of and I
can't wait to be able to take gone
more
